name: Day 1 - Alpine Camp Setup at 1847m
content: Lena establishing base camp at 1847m elevation in the Alps after 5 AM start hike. Assessed conditions: 2°C temperature, 15cm snow depth, north wind. Set up four-season tent on frozen ground with secure staking against wind. Organized critical gear: minus-15 rated sleeping bag, bear-resistant food container. Located water source 50m away requiring filtration and boiling. Started camp stove for coffee while planning navigation. Confirmed GPS position and identified western trail to summit. Reviewed three-day forecast: decent conditions with possible Wednesday snow. Planned acclimatization strategy: day hike to 2400m with return to camp. Expressed deep appreciation for solo wilderness experience - peace, silence, mountain views from camp, escape from urban noise. Methodical preparation balanced with mindful presence.
summary: Camp setup at 1847m: secured tent in snow, organized gear, located water, planned 2400m acclimatization hike
background_sounds: wind, stream flowing nearby, tent fabric rustling, stove hissing
